header.title: Documentation
header.subtitle: Everything you need to know about discovering, integrating, and using MCP servers effectively.

introduction.title: Introduction to Magic MCP
introduction.description: Magic MCP is your comprehensive platform for discovering, evaluating, and integrating Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. Whether you're building AI applications or enhancing existing systems, Magic MCP provides the tools and resources you need.
introduction.mcpDescription: The Model Context Protocol is a standardized way for AI applications to connect with external data sources and tools.

quickStart.title: Quick Start Guide
quickStart.description: Get up and running with MCP servers in just a few minutes. Follow these simple steps to integrate your first server.

step1.title: Discover a Server
step1.description: Browse our catalog or use the search function to find a server that meets your needs.

step2.title: Install the Server
step2.description: Follow the installation instructions for your preferred method (npm, pip, Docker).

step3.title: Configure Your Application
step3.description: Connect your AI application to the MCP server using the provided configuration.

step4.title: Start Building
step4.description: Your MCP server is now ready! Start building amazing AI-powered applications.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: MCP servers can be installed using various package managers and deployment methods. Choose the method that best fits your development environment.

whatIsMcp.title: What is Model Context Protocol?
whatIsMcp.description: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard that enables AI applications to securely connect with external data sources, tools, and services. It provides a standardized way for AI models to access and interact with various resources while maintaining security and control.
whatIsMcp.clientServerArchitecture: Client-Server Architecture: AI applications (clients) connect to MCP servers that provide specific capabilities
whatIsMcp.standardizedProtocol: Standardized Protocol: All communication follows the MCP specification for consistency
whatIsMcp.resourceAccess: Resource Access: Servers expose resources (data, tools, prompts) that clients can discover and use
whatIsMcp.secureBoundaries: Secure Boundaries: Each server operates within defined security boundaries and permissions

serverTypes.title: Server Types & Categories
serverTypes.description: MCP servers come in various types, each designed for specific use cases. Understanding these categories helps you choose the right server for your needs.

permissionErrors.ensureCredentials: Ensure API keys and credentials are correct

choosingServer.question: How do I choose the right MCP server?
choosingServer.answer: Consider your specific use case, the type of data or functionality you need, and the server's compatibility with your tech stack. Use our filtering and search features to narrow down options, and check community ratings and reviews.

security.question: Are MCP servers secure?
security.answer: Yes, MCP servers are designed with security in mind. They operate within defined boundaries, support permission controls, and follow the MCP security specifications. Always review the server's documentation and configure appropriate access controls.

multipleServers.question: Can I use multiple MCP servers together?
multipleServers.answer: Absolutely! Most AI applications use multiple MCP servers to access different types of resources. The MCP protocol is designed to support multiple concurrent server connections.

contribute.question: How do I contribute a new server?
contribute.answer: We welcome community contributions! You can submit your MCP server through our GitHub repository or contact us directly. Make sure your server follows MCP specifications and includes proper documentation.

callToAction.title: Ready to Get Started?
callToAction.description: Explore our collection of MCP servers and start building amazing AI applications today.
